trigger_event: Late after Halden’s death, Rada arrived at Bar 101 with a shaky USB drive—uncut footage from a resource center and a leaked medical report on Halden. Alex, pouring her a drink, listened as she wrestled aloud with what to do.
dilemma: Rada must decide whether to quietly calm public fears by suggesting a new leader will take charge soon, or to expose the chaos and coverup, risking mass panic to force action. Both options could change the course of the crisis—one toward order, the other toward upheaval.
reason: Rada knows a false sense of stability could protect the vulnerable from chaos, but hiding the truth lets power escape scrutiny. Yet, dropping all the truth could spark riots and make things worse for those without access to food and medicine.
choice_a: Release a carefully edited story implying an interim leader is coming and that stability is within reach, downplaying the most incendiary evidence.
belief_a: Order, even if delicate, is better than open chaos.
Protecting the vulnerable must come before exposing the powerful.
Small reforms are more likely if panic is avoided.
choice_b: Broadcast unedited footage and the full confidential report, exposing the depth of the crisis and government secrets to everyone.
belief_b: Truth matters more than temporary comfort.
Only exposure can force real accountability and change.
The public deserves to know exactly what’s happening, no matter the risk.
